sentences.en: A stormy applause broke out in the hall.
sentences.cn: 全场响起了暴风雨般的掌声.

sentences.en: Fortunately, the stormy waves caused trifling damage to the boat.
sentences.cn: 幸好, 风浪使船只受到的损坏较轻.

sentences.en: I'm afraid you're running a risk setting sail in such stormy weather.
sentences.cn: 挑上这么个暴风雨的天气出航,你恐怕太冒险了吧!

sentences.en: Sailors wear oilskins in stormy weather.
sentences.cn: 水手遇到暴风雨天气都穿著防水服.

sentences.en: Sinclair Lewis was stormy petrel in his life as in his books.
sentences.cn: 辛克莱·刘易斯在他的生活中也像他的书中一样是个制造麻烦的人.
暴风雨般掌声震动了大厅.

sentences.en: The arrow on the barometer was pointing to'stormy ".
sentences.cn: 气压计上的箭头指向 “ 有暴风雨 ”.

sentences.en: The audience broke out into a stormy applause.
sentences.cn: 观众中爆发出暴风雨般的掌声.

sentences.en: The boat wallowed helplessly in the stormy sea.
sentences.cn: 那艘船在波浪滔滔的大海中无力地颠簸行驶.

sentences.en: The letter was read at a stormy meeting.
sentences.cn: 这封信是在一次争吵激烈的会议上念的。

sentences.en: The marriage began in a stormy fashion, but soon settled down.
sentences.cn: 新婚生活非常热烈, 但不久就平静下来了.

sentences.en: The sailboat swayed on the stormy sea.
sentences.cn: 帆船在暴风雨的海面上摇晃.

sentences.en: The sky was starting to look stormy.
sentences.cn: 开始变天了，看上去暴风雨将至。

sentences.en: Their working relationship was stormy at times.
sentences.cn: 他们在工作中关系有时也闹得很僵。

sentences.en: Very few people ventured to go out on that stormy night.
sentences.cn: 在那个风雨交加的夜晚,很少有人敢出去.

words.tran_cn: 为风暴所阻的，因暴风雨而被困的
起风暴；横冲直撞；狂怒咆哮
激烈的,咆哮的,发怒的,焦躁的,疯狂的

trans.tran_cn: 有暴风雨的，暴风雨般的，热烈的，激烈的
trans.tran_en: with strong winds, heavy rain, and dark clouds
